examples: he could hear the clang of distant bells

definitions.text: a serious accident (usually involving one or more vehicles)
examples: they are still investigating the crash of the TWA plane

definitions.text: a sudden large decline of business or the prices of stocks (especially one that causes additional failures)
the act of colliding with something
examples: his crash through the window
the fullback's smash into the defensive line

definitions.text: (computer science) an event that causes a computer system to become inoperative
examples: the crash occurred during a thunderstorm and the system has been down ever since
The branch crashed down on my car
The plane crashed in the sea

definitions.text: move with, or as if with, a crashing noise
examples: The car crashed through the glass door

definitions.text: undergo damage or destruction on impact
examples: the plane crashed into the ocean
The car crashed into the lamp post

definitions.text: move violently as through a barrier
examples: The terrorists crashed the gate
My son's friends crashed our house last weekend
the waves crashed on the shore and kept us awake all night
let's crash the party!
The terrorists crashed the plane into the palace
Mother crashed the motorbike into the lamppost
He dashed the plate against the wall
Waves were dashing against the rock

definitions.text: undergo a sudden and severe downturn
examples: the economy crashed
will the stock market crash again?
My computer crashed last night
The system goes down at least once a week
You can crash here, though it's not very comfortable
